required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Factors Associated With Residual Disease In The Central Cone
clinical_study.official_title: Factors Associated With Residual Disease In The Central Cone: A Disease Prediction Model

brief_summary.textblock: Cervical conization using the loop electrosurgical excision procedure (LEEP) is the standard treatment for patients with high-grade cervical intraepithelial neoplasia. Several studies have shown that excising a central cone reduces the rate of positive endocervical margins. The purpose of this study is to identify clinicopathological factors associated with residual disease in the central cone and to develop a predictive model to better determine which patients may require this additional procedure.

detailed_description.textblock: This study pretends to create a retrospective database including all patient who underwent a loop electrosurgical excision procedure by treatment for high-grade cervical intraepithelial neoplasia and create a a predictive model for top-hat resection in patients with high grade CIN

primary_outcome.measure: Number of clinicopathologic factors associated with residual disease
primary_outcome.description: Develop a predictive model to determine which individuals may require additional procedures in the uterine cervix to ensure negative margins

study_pop.textblock: patients who underwent a cervical cone procedure at the Dysplasia Clinic of the Instituto Nacional de Cancerologia in Mexico City

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who underwent a loop electrosurgical excision procedure (LEEP)
Exclusion Criteria:
- a diagnosis of micro-invasion or nonsquamous histology
- less than six months of follow-up
- incomplete information in their clinical charts.
